Issues.Title: Winforms-When added the option(button) in panel not shown the option with DPIAwaresness in 4.7.2 .NET framework
Issues.Body:
**Describe the bug**
Control size and alignment is not proper in the panel with DPI awareness in 4.7.2 framework, but working fine in all other .NET frameworks.

```xml
XML code:
<System.Windows.Forms.ApplicationConfigurationSection>
    <add key="DpiAwareness" value="PerMonitorV2"/>    
  </System.Windows.Forms.ApplicationConfigurationSection>
```
**Sample**
[FrameWorkPanel.zip](https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/files/3250834/FrameWorkPanel.zip)

**Steps to reproduce the bug**
1.Run the Sample.
2.Click the button in the form.

**Observed**
Button is not properly added and aligned. Button text is not shown.

**Screenshots**
![FrameWork_4 7 2](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/44993310/58794252-63e68e00-8615-11e9-8578-83c8e45bfe8c.png)

**Expected**
Button should be properly aligned as below.

**Screenshots**
![FrameWork_4 6](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/44993310/58797033-84661680-861c-11e9-9ec9-7988420aef29.png)

**Additional context**
Attached the Same sample  shown the option properly when framework as 4.6
This cases reproduced 4.7.2 frame work only.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Winforms-When added the option(button) in panel not shown the option with DPIAwaresness in 4.7.2 .NET framework" (#1085)

Issues.Title: disable some unit tests that are failing local debug builds

Issues.Title: VisualStyle unit tests failing locally, passing in CI builds
Issues.Body:
Tried looking into the issue, but it's failing in interop code and I'm not familiar enough with this to debug. Tagging @hughbe since he worked on this last. Hughbe did these work for you when you ran .\build -test locally? (note that these only fail in debug mode, not when specifying -configuration Release)

I'm going to comment out these tests since they are blocking local development and we can revisit later.

Errors are below:

Issues.Title: Fixed CodeDOM serialization of primitives
Issues.Body:
Serializer was adding unnecessary casts to primitive expressions.
For example ((int)(42)) instead of 42.

Issues.Title: The dropdown list is empty after first clicking the “BackColor” property when first running the .NET Core application
Issues.Body:
•	.NET Core Version: .NET Core 3.0.100-preview6-012162 from master branch
•	Have you experienced this same bug with .NET Framework?: No

**More info:**

1.	The issue also can reproduce on the latest .NET Core 3.0.100-preview6-12226 from release branch.
2.	The issue can’t reproduce on the .NET Core 3.0.100-preview6-12101 build from master branch.
3.	The issue also can reproduce on the all controls which have the related “dropdown” property.

**Repro Steps:**
1.	Installed the latest .NET SDK 3.0 from: https://github.com/dotnet/core-sdk. 
2.	Build and run the attached application.
[ReproApplication.zip](https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/files/3246776/ReproApplication.zip)
3.	Click the Open button of the “BackColor” property using mouse。
![ReproSteps](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/38325459/58791241-6dc3bd80-8624-11e9-8e68-af9af4607fe8.gif)

 **Actual behavior:**
The dropdown list of “BackColor” property is empty after first clicking.
![Issue](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/38325459/58791171-4d93fe80-8624-11e9-9e9d-f694a13eb63c.PNG)

**Expected behavior:**
The dropdown list of “BackColor” property should not be empty and showed as following screenshot.
![ExpectedResults](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/38325459/58790221-816e2480-8622-11e9-984a-6daab6aaf009.PNG)
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "The dropdown list is empty after first clicking the “BackColor” property when first running the .NET Core application" (#1084)

Issues.Title: [Loc]The description text is not showing correctly in MultilineStringEditor drop down.
Issues.Body:
* .NET Core Version: 3.0.100-preview6-012122 from Master branch
* Have you experienced this same bug with .NET Framework?: No

<!-- Read https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/blob/master/Documentation/issue-guide.md -->

**Problem description:**
The description text is not showing correctly in MultilineStringEditor drop down.

Issues | Description | Affected language
-- | -- | --
Issue#1 | Description text is not showing in MultilineStringEditor drop down. | TRK, CSY, JPN,   FRA, KOR, PTB,PLK, DEU,
Issue#2 | 2 description sentences should be shown in 2 lines, need to wrap. | CHS, CHT, RUS,   ITA, ESN

**Actual behavior:** <!-- callstack for crashes / exceptions -->
**Issue#1**: Description text is not showing in MultilineStringEditor drop down. 
![Core](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/49627022/58677215-ae55d980-838d-11e9-8e2a-0d8960b1aa9c.PNG)
**Issue#2**: 2 description sentences doesn't wrap.
![222](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/49627022/58677405-64b9be80-838e-11e9-80c7-a02e3b3918d7.png)

**Expected behavior:**
Description text should be show in MultilineStringEditor drop down, and 2 description sentences should be wrap.
![Fra](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/49627022/58677224-b44bba80-838d-11e9-8676-b5e8bb53fd4b.PNG)

**Minimal repro:**
1.Install latest VS & .NET Core 3.0 on loc machine, then open the attached app.
[WindowsFormsApp2.zip](https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/files/3239429/WindowsFormsApp2.zip)
2.Run it and open the MultilineStringEditor drop down of **Text** property.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "[Loc]The description text is not showing correctly in MultilineStringEditor drop down." (#1076)

Issues.Title: Screen.AllScreens return different size
Issues.Body:
* .NET Core Version: (e.g. 3.0 Preview1, or daily build number, use `dotnet --info`)
* Have you experienced this same bug with .NET Framework?: Yes/No

<!-- Read https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/blob/master/Documentation/issue-guide.md -->

**Problem description:**  

 Screen.AllScreens return different size between framework and netcore ,system DPI 125%  

**Actual behavior:** <!-- callstack for crashes / exceptions -->
  
 net core
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/80653/58603529-b1849300-82c3-11e9-8afc-7dee8439d1fc.png)  
  
**Expected behavior:**
 framework 4.7.2
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/80653/58603550-c9f4ad80-82c3-11e9-8143-64efed9d4c22.png)  
  
**Minimal repro:**
 https://github.com/giantapp-libraries/LiveWallpaperEngine/blob/master/LiveWallpaperEngine/LiveWallpaperEngineManager.cs

Line:56
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue " Screen.AllScreens return different size " (#1071)

Issues.Title: An exception pops up when using the method GetData(Type format) of IDataObject
Issues.Body:
* .NET Core Version: .NET Core 3.0.100-preview6-012101 from master branch
* Have you experienced this same bug with .NET Framework?: No

<!-- Read https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/blob/master/Documentation/issue-guide.md -->

**Minimal repro:**
1. Create a Winforms .Net Core application.
2. Write code to Form1.cs.
 IDataObject o = Clipboard.GetDataObject();
 string got = (String)o.GetData(typeof(String));
3. Build and run the application.

**Actual behavior:** <!-- callstack for crashes / exceptions -->
When debugging to _string got = (String)o.GetData(typeof(String))_, the exception pops up.
![error](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/49627022/58549157-7b043500-823d-11e9-951a-f4b49bc61fd0.PNG)

**Expected behavior:**
No exception pops up, application runs successfully.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "An exception pops up when using the method GetData(Type format) of IDataObject" (#1064)
